message.content:
cs.CR, cs.NI, cs.MM, cs.DS, cs.IT

The paper discusses network steganography, which involves hiding information within network protocols and traffic. This falls under the category of computer security (cs.CR) and networked systems (cs.NI). The paper also mentions techniques such as packet fragmentation and covert channels, which are commonly used in multimedia systems (cs.MM) and data structures (cs.DS). Additionally, the paper discusses the use of coding and encryption in network steganography, which is related to information theory (cs.IT).
